title: Takahoot
description:
You know Kahoot right? [Kahoot](https://www.kahoot.com) is a great Quizz platform mostly used for educational purposes!

For Takima, we wanted to have a **better** and **cooler** controller than just a normal phone... So we made [TaKahoot](https://github.com/resourcepool/takahoot).

Takahoot is a physical target for Kahoot that behaves as a normal player and allows to be trigged by a nice shot from your favorite Nerf gun.

![Takahoot Box](images/takahoot-box.jpg)![Takahoot Triggers before mount](images/takahoot-triggers.jpg)

We made everything from scratch, from the **3D STL models**, printed some parts with a 3D Printer, cut some others with a laser-cutting device, implemented the controller with a simple Serial protocol with Arduino and of course a great user-friendly client in Electron & Angular.

title: Blindtest Live App
description:
On the side, I love playing live music. Together with some friends, we came up with a cool concept: **Live Blindtests**!

It was easy and fun to guess when you had 20 people playing... Not the same with 500.

So we built an app to answer live, play jokers and provide people with an incredible gameplay while they will also cry out loud their favorite songs!

![Blind Test Live helper app](images/blindtest-live-1.jpg)![Blind Test Live leaderboard](images/blindtest-live-2.jpg)

Wanna get crazy? Look us up on Facebook and join us in our many concerts in and around Paris! The name is **[The Bold Heads](https://www.facebook.com/TheBoldHeads)**

title: Deadlock
description:
This is my biggest project right now.  **Deadlock** will be the first OpenSource **coding & hacking game** platform.  Our goal? Simply reinvent the way people learn computer-science, and the way we get our new recruits.  
The project is a year-long project and should be OpenSourced before the end of year 2018.  

![Deadlock player dashboard](images/deadlock-1.jpg)![Deadlock story hall](images/deadlock-2.jpg)  

Want to take part in the project? **Message me**!  Want to try it out? **go ahead**, it's live!

title: Student Trainings
description:
How to get better at programming Java applications.  
This training material was carefully setup to enable university-level students to get back in touch with their basic java and JEE skills. It is designed to be served as a hackathon.  
Many projects have been released:  
[Code Review Scheduler (1 week)](https://github.com/resourcepool/training-welcomepool)

title: IOT Projects
description:
I'm starting to get passioned about IoT. Therefore, I started doing a few libs and other stuff to help during personal projects.  
 #### **SSDP** Java Client:  
It was hard to find a good implementation for SSDP on the web, so I made my own. Asynchronous, lightweight, and bullet-proof. [See it here](https://github.com/resourcepool/ssdp-client).  
 #### **JSON-RPC 2.0** Java client:  
A lightweight full implementation of JSON-RPC 2.0 in Java. Compatible with Java 6 and above. Available on central. [Let's see it](https://github.com/resourcepool/jarpic-client)  
 #### LUA Http-server for **NodeMCU** & **ESP-8266** microcontrollers:  
Low-level, memory-efficient, node-like API & middleware compatible. [Let's see it](https://github.com/loicortola/nodemcu-espress)  
 #### End-to-end **5050 Led Controller**:  
PCB Board + Hardware list + Firmware + Android app.  
Great to learn how to make IoT objects and get some awesome sample code running. Now currently working on bigger API refactorings to be compatible with Xiaomi devices and on a Zigbee Light Link implementation with NXP microcontrollers. [See it here](https://github.com/loicortola/led-controller)  

![Remote Control App for my custom LED Controller](images/ledcontroller-remote-app-sm.jpg)![Custom-made PCB v1 and v2 for my custom LED Controller](images/ledcontroller-pcb-sm.jpg)
